alert.note: Alert for Gove (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 04 at 10:46PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gove County through 1130 PM CST... At 1046 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shields, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Gove County. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas near mile marker 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
